intro: Menestoria mussaendae, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in dense, showy inflorescences. Menestoria mussaendae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
